summary: This document is an email chain from June 12-13, 2019, between a U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) prosecutor and an FBI agent, Sean Watson. They are coordinating a meeting to discuss the expedited charging timeline for Jeffrey Epstein, including reviewing case files from Florida, securing physical evidence, and planning for the arrest operation.

persons.name: Sean Watson
persons.context: FBI agent in New York coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office on the Epstein case, specifically regarding evidence review and arrest planning.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The target of the criminal investigation and impending charges being discussed by law enforcement.

connections.description: Sean Watson, as an FBI agent, is involved in the investigation and impending arrest of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Expedited Charging Timeline Discussion
events.description: Law enforcement officials discuss an expedited timetable to charge Jeffrey Epstein within the next few weeks, including evidence review and arrest planning.

events.title: Coordination Meeting Scheduled
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for June 13, 2019, between a USANYS prosecutor and FBI Agent Sean Watson to align on the Epstein case details.

keyFacts: In June 2019, U.S. prosecutors and the FBI were actively planning to charge Jeffrey Epstein on an expedited timeline, aiming for action within 'the next few weeks'.
The planning involved a comprehensive review of the case file and physical evidence transferred from Florida to New York.
Officials were coordinating an 'extensive operation' for Epstein's arrest, indicating it was imminent and involved multiple approaches.
The email chain shows direct coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the FBI regarding the final stages of the investigation.
